titleStmt.title: The pious mans practice in Parliament time. Or A seasonable and necessary tractate concerning the presages, and causes of a common-wealths ruine, and the wayes, and meanes to preserve a church, and state, in prosperity, plenty, purity, and peace. By R. Ward, utriusque regni in Artibus Magister; and preacher of Gods holy word at Stansteed Mount-Fitchet in Essex.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Richard, 1601 or 2-1684.

titleStmt.title: The pious mans practice in Parliament time. Or A seasonable and necessary tractate concerning the presages, and causes of a common-wealths ruine, and the wayes, and meanes to preserve a church, and state, in prosperity, plenty, purity, and peace. By R. Ward, utriusque regni in Artibus Magister; and preacher of Gods holy word at Stansteed Mount-Fitchet in Essex.
titleStmt.author: Ward, Richard, 1601 or 2-1684.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T. Cotes for P. Cole, at the signe of the Glove and Lyon in Corne-hill neere the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The second part, propositions 4 and 5, has separate pagination and register.
With an imprimatur dated Novemb. 19. 1640 on the final leaf (2H12r).
2H10 is mis-signed 2I2; the penultimate leaf (2H11) is blank.
Reproduction of the original in the Lambeth Palace Library, London.
